revised_title: Order-disorder Transformations in Graphite Nitrates: Structural Studies
tldr: The authors studied the order-disorder transformations in graphite nitrates using X-ray diffraction. They found that the stacking sequences of carbon hexagon layers in these compounds can be generated from the stacking in normal graphite. When cooled through a specific temperature, increased ordering appears in the low-temperature structures, and each intercalate layer exhibits two-dimensional long-range order. This research provides insights into the molecular packing and structural changes in graphite nitrates.
